definition: to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
to reject/to discard/to get rid of
pure and limpid/(of a person) quick-witted
erhua variant of 挑毛剔刺[tiao1 mao2 ti1 ci4]

sentences.english: Next time, ask the butcher to bone the meat.
sentences.chinese: 下次讓賣肉的把肉裏的骨頭剔出來。

sentences.english: Please tick the appropriate box(es) and fill in the quantity of T-shirt(s).
sentences.chinese: 請在下列適當之空格內填上剔號並輸入所需之數量。

sentences.english: Will you bone this joint of meat for me?
sentences.chinese: 下次讓賣肉的把肉裏的骨頭剔出來。

sentences.english: Even Scott, who is allergic to fish, was boning fish and preparing the dishes.
sentences.chinese: 曾經一向對魚比較敏感的斯科特也在剔魚骨做飯。

sentences.english: In ancient Egypt, people used to shave their eyebrows to mourn the death of their cats.
sentences.chinese: 在古埃及，人們經常通過剔眉毛的方式來緬懷死貓。

sentences.english: The Jackpots will tick up and carry over to any game you play.
sentences.chinese: 該獎金剔起來，並結轉到任何你的遊戲角色。

definition: to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
(literary) to fracture (a bone)/(literary) to cut/to hack/variant of 銼|锉[cuo4]
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
tweezers/forceps/nippers/pliers/to nip/to pick up with tweezers/to pluck out
a saw/to cut with a saw
